abstract_summ: We studied the complete genomes of 95 SARS-CoV-2 strains from different geographical regions worldwide to uncover the pattern of the spread of the virus.In this study we investigate the genetic diversity and genomic epidemiology of SARS-CoV-2 using 22 virus genome sequences reported by three different laboratories in Morocco till the date 07/06/2020 as well as (40366) virus genomes from all around the world.Results It was found that (i) temporal variation in frequencies of types of the coronavirus was significant; ancestral viruses of type O were replaced by evolved viruses belonging to type A2a; (ii) spatial variation was not significant; with the spread of SARS-CoV-2, the dominant virus was the A2a type virus in every geographical region; (iii) within a geographical region, there was significant micro-level variation in the frequencies of the different viral types, and (iv) the evolved coronavirus of type A2a swept rapidly across all continents.The genotyping analysis of SARS-CoV-2 isolates from the globe reveals that specific multiple mutations are the predominated mutation type during the current epidemic.The genotyping analysis of SARS-CoV-2 isolates from the globe reveals that specific multiple mutations are the predominated mutation type during the current epidemic.
title_summ: SARS-CoV-2 exhibits intra-host genomic plasticity and low-frequency polymorphic quasispeciesIdentification of unique mutations in SARS-CoV-2 strains isolated from India suggests its attenuated pathotypeComprehensive evolution and molecular characteristics of a large number of SARS-CoV-2 genomes revealed its epidemic trend and possible originsThe impact of super-spreaders in COVID-19: mapping genome variation worldwideGenome-wide variations of SARS-CoV-2 infer evolution relationship and transmission routeGenetic Diversity and Genomic Epidemiology of SARS-COV-2 in MoroccoComparative Genomic Analysis of Rapidly Evolving SARS-CoV-2 Viruses Reveal Mosaic Pattern of Phylogeographical DistributionGenotyping coronavirus SARS-CoV-2: methods and implicationsGenomic characterization of a novel SARS-CoV-2Emergence of genomic diversity and recurrent mutations in SARS-CoV-2Genotyping coronavirus SARS-CoV-2: Methods and implicationsPhylogenetic network analysis of SARS-CoV-2 genomesGenome-Wide Identification and Characterization of Point Mutations in the SARS-CoV-2 GenomeGenome-wide data inferring the evolution and population demography of the novel pneumonia coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2)Analysis of RNA sequences of 3636 SARS-CoV-2 collected from 55 countries reveals selective sweep of one virus type.
title_abstract_phrases: In this study we investigate the genetic diversity and genomic epidemiology of SARS-CoV-2 using 22 virus genome sequences reported by three different laboratories in Morocco till the date 07/06/2020 as well as (40366) virus genomes from all around the world.We studied the complete genomes of 95 SARS-CoV-2 strains from different geographical regions worldwide to uncover the pattern of the spread of the virus.Conclusions In this study, the evolution and molecular characteristics of more than 16000 genomic sequences provided a new perspective for revealing epidemiology of SARS-CoV-2.The impact of super-spreaders in COVID-19: mapping genome variation worldwideThe human pathogen severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is responsible for the major pandemic of the 21st century.Phylogenetic analyses revealed that Moroccan SARS-CoV-2 genomes included 9 viruses pertaining to clade 20A, 9 to clade 20B and 2 to clade 20C.The genotyping analysis of SARS-CoV-2 isolates from the globe reveals that specific multiple mutations are the predominated mutation type during the current epidemic.
